page.title: 09WOODLANDS FARM, COOKHAM DEAN
page.content: Woodlands Farm is situated on the edge of Cookham Dean village. It is owned by Mr Simmonds who is a member of the European Parliament. It is quite an old farm, the farm-house dates back to the 1800's. Two main activities are carried out at the farm: the rearing of poultry, and stabling of horses for local people. The farm has over 1500 Isiss Browns, which are being reared in a rather different way. They live in a very large coop, one side of which has a number of doors so that the birds can roam over the adjacent fields to look for food. However, they are also fed three times a day with pelletised feed in the chicken house. This method is a cross between battery feeding, and free range. It is quite expensive, but the the eggs certainly tasted good!
